results.title: See me
results.brief_description: Catherine delves into the mind of a lady, once independent but now forced to adjust to a life of restriction and questions of a personal nature. This story touches on the universal need to be seen as a person, still full of life and potential, rather than a problem.

results.title: Nihiwatu
results.creator_credit: Christiana Stergiou, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: On the remote Indonesian island of Sumba is the village of Nihiwatu, a place that can only be found in the Ethical Travel Guide. It was here that Christiana Stergiou discovered her utopia, and a place that, despite being a seasoned traveller, she will never forget.

results.title: Kaante
results.creator_credit: Sanjay Gupta, Pritish Nandy Communications and Raju Patel
results.brief_description: This Bollywood remake of “Reservoir dogs” (Tarantino, 1992) is a lot of fun to watch with its musical numbers and an inventive reworking of the central narrative about a gang of criminals who are infiltrated by an undercover cop. After pulling off a daring bank robbery, and lucky escape from the law, the band retreat to sniff out the nark among them. Featuring sprightly performances by Amitabh Bachchan, Sanjay Dutt, Suniel Shetty, Mahesh Manjrekar, Lucky Ali and Kumar Gaurav, the narrative also addresses ethnic stereotyping as the crew lament their treatment at the hands of the Los Angeles Police Department.

results.title: Ka-wayawayama: Aeroplane Dance
results.creator_credit: Jan Wositzky, Trevor Graham, Christina Pozzan and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Records the story of “Ka-wayawayama” or “Aeroplane Dance” of the Yanuwa people of the Borroloola area in the Northern Territory. The dance was created after an American “Liberator” bomber crashed in the area in 1942, after a mission in the South-west Pacific. Re-creates the plight of the flight crew in their trek across inhospitable terrain across the Gulf of Carpentaria and the search for the lost crew.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jan Wositzky, Trevor Graham, Christina Pozzan and Film Australia

results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (November 2008)
results.brief_description: These eight Digital Stories were created by members of the general public in Melbourne, Victoria. Mostly concerned with the concept of home, these eight different people provide a variety of perspectives.
